alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Lewis and Clark; Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 6:02PM MDT until June 08 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Cascade County in central Montana... South Central Teton County in north central Montana... Central Lewis and Clark County in west central Montana... * Until 900 PM MDT. * At 602 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has already fallen. Additional thunderstorms moving in across the area are expected to produce rainfall rates of between 0.75 to 1.5 inches in the next 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Cascade, South Central Teton and Central Lewis and Clark Counties FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
